ai_choice.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Isle of Wight - Choice

Best match.Title: Guidance for your project
Best match.Reason: The page provides useful links and guides for renovation, which aligns with David's need to understand what changes he can make to his flat and how to request permission.

ai_page.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Isle of Wight - Page
ai_page.body:
Guidance for your project

Building regulation charges explained The charges for Building Regulation work covers the cost of providing the service.

Methods of establishing the charge

  • Standard charges (a set cost)
  • Individually determined charges (quotation by Building Control)
    • Standard charges are for common domestic projects and small non-domestic projects
    • If the type of work is not listed as a standard charge, the fee is based on the estimated cost of work from a tradesperson
    • Larger schemes will be individually determined

We will give an individually determined quotation within five working days from the date of request. The quotation is valid for six months.

  • For a Full plans application:
    • You need to pay the Plan Charge when you submit your application
    • You will receive an invoice for the Inspection Charge upon commencement of works
  • For a Building Notice application:
    • You need to pay the total Building Notice charge when you submit your application
    • The total charge is equivalent to the Full Plans Plan Charge plus the Inspection Charge
  • There is an extra charge for large projects submitted under a Building Notice. This is because of the added complexity of ensuring compliance with the regulations.
  • Full Plans applications are required for all non-domestic work.

Email building.control@iow.gov.uk for more information and a quotation.

Additional charges and notes

  • Postal applications will incur an additional £25 administration charge.
  • The charge for Regularisation applications will be 150% of the equivalent net total charge.
  • Where an application has not had a site visit for over 2 years due to the works ceasing or being completed with no notification to the authority, an additional charge of £75 + VAT (£90) will be made to undertake a completion inspection and issue a completion certificate if works are considered satisfactory.
    • If further visits are required to complete the works then additional charges may also be required.

These notes are not comprehensive. Please email building.control@iow.gov.uk if you need further help. The full scheme for the recovery of building control charges is available on request.

Useful links and guides for renovation

If you are a homeowner planning to update, renovate or extend your property, these guides may be useful:

  • The extensions and conversion guide includes information on loft conversions, garage conversions, cellar conversions and building an extension
  • The green home guide provides information and advice on how to create environmentally friendly homes
  • The Planning Portal interactive house provides access to a wide range of information to help you with your project
  • LABC Front Door provides independent practical advice on all aspects of home improvements, and much more. LABC represent all local building control teams in England Wales.
  • The Historic Buildings guide provides information on regulations and requirements

Building over or near a public sewer or shared drain

If you are thinking about building an extension, conservatory or garage to your home, this could have an impact on your underground sewers. At an early stage you will need to know where your pipes are as this could affect your design. You may also need approval from Southern Water.

Party wall guidance

If you intend to carry out building work affecting the party wall or make excavations near the party wall. You will need to be aware of your responsibilities detailed in the Party Wall etc. Act 1996. This is a separate piece of legislation to the building regulations and is not controllable by us.

ai_feedback.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Isle of Wight - Feedback

ai_issue.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Isle of Wight - Issue

text_improvements.original:
Guidance for your project
Building regulation charges explained
The charges for Building Regulation work covers the cost of providing the service.
text_improvements.issue: The opening is focused on charges rather than providing a clear, step-by-step guide for requesting permission for flat improvements, which was the user's main concern.

text_improvements.original: We will give an individually determined quotation within five working days from the date of request. The quotation is valid for six months.
text_improvements.issue: This information about quotations and timelines does not address the need for straightforward steps on how to submit a request, upload photos, and receive approval—leading to a lack of clarity about the process.

text_improvements.original: Email building.control@iow.gov.uk for more information and a quotation.
text_improvements.issue: While providing an email contact is helpful, the absence of a simple online form or direct link to request permission makes the process less accessible and clear for users seeking straightforward guidance.

ai_improvement.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Isle of Wight - Improvement

ai_business_case.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Isle of Wight - Business Case
ai_business_case.letter:
To the CEO:

Subject: Recommendations for Improving Customer Experience and Increasing Service Efficiency

Based on the recent analysis of the customer persona, feedback, and issues encountered by users like David, our primary goal should be to simplify and clarify the process for requesting permission to make small improvements to council flats.

**Current Findings:**
- The existing webpage predominantly discusses building regulation charges, which does not directly address the main concern: how tenants can easily request permission, upload supporting documents, and receive timely updates.
- Customer feedback indicates a need for a straightforward, step-by-step guide that includes clear instructions, direct links or online forms, and estimated timelines.
- The lack of an easily accessible online self-service option contributes to user frustration and potential delays, which could increase administrative workload and associated costs.

**Specific Recommendations:**
1. **Develop a dedicated online request form for flat improvements** that guides tenants through each step:
   - Clear instructions on what information to upload (photos, plans).
   - Options to track application status and receive updates automatically via email or SMS.
   - Estimated timelines for decision-making, such as approval within a specified number of days.

2. **Create a unified landing page** that succinctly explains the process:
   - Start with a simple overview.
   - Include direct links to the online form.
   - Provide FAQs addressing common concerns about delays, decision times, and compliance.

3. **Integrate automated notifications** to keep tenants informed throughout the process, reducing the need for manual follow-up and improving transparency.

**Positive Impact:**
- Making the process more intuitive will likely decrease inbound queries, freeing staff time and reducing administrative costs.
- Enhanced transparency and ease of use can increase tenant satisfaction, potentially reducing complaint handling.
- Automating updates and streamlining requests will improve service efficiency and help the Council meet modern digital standards, reflecting a forward-thinking approach.

**Conclusion:**
Implementing these improvements could significantly enhance user satisfaction, reduce service delivery costs, and position the Council as a leader in accessible digital services. I recommend prioritizing the development of this online permission request pathway and revising related content to focus on the user journey, thus aligning our digital offerings with tenant needs.

Respectfully,

[Your Name]  
Web Usability & Service Improvement Lead
